security.label: Security & Access
security.description: Bucket policy, ACL, and CORS configuration

lifecycle.label: Lifecycle
lifecycle.description: Lifecycle rules and automatic deletion policies

inventory.label: Inventory
inventory.description: Automated bucket inventory reports and configuration

globalAdminReadOnly: Global admins cannot modify tenant bucket settings

versioning.title: Versioning
versioning.confirmEnableMsg: This will enable object versioning for this bucket.
versioning.confirmSuspendMsg: This will suspend object versioning for this bucket.

policy.title: Bucket Policy
policy.description: Define fine-grained permissions using JSON policy documents
policy.confirmDeleteMsg: This will remove all custom access policies for this bucket.
policy.editorTip: You can use templates as a starting point, then customize them in the editor.
policy.policyJsonHint: Enter a valid S3 bucket policy in JSON format. The policy will be validated before saving.
policy.templatesWarning: These templates grant public access. Use carefully and only when needed.
policy.invalidJsonMsg: Please enter a valid JSON policy document

publicRead.name: Public Read Access
publicRead.description: Allow anonymous read access to all objects

publicReadWrite.name: Public Read/Write Access
publicReadWrite.description: Allow anonymous read and write access

acl.title: Access Control List (ACL)
acl.description: Control who can access this bucket
acl.aclInfo: ACL (Access Control List) defines who can access your bucket and what permissions they have. Choose a canned ACL for simple permission management.
acl.privateDesc: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL. No one else has access rights.
acl.publicReadDesc: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL. Anyone (including anonymous users) can READ objects.
acl.publicReadWriteDesc: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL. Anyone can READ and WRITE objects.
acl.authenticatedReadDesc: Owner gets FULL_CONTROL. Any authenticated AWS user can READ objects.
acl.publicWarning: This ACL grants public access. Anyone on the internet can access your bucket.

tags.title: Tags
tags.confirmDeleteAllMsg: This will remove all tags from this bucket.
tags.tagsInfo: Tags are key-value pairs that help you organize and categorize your buckets.

cors.title: CORS Configuration
cors.confirmDeleteMsg: This will remove all CORS rules for this bucket.
cors.noRules: No CORS rules configured. Click "Add Rule" to create one.
cors.maxAgeHint: How long browsers can cache preflight results (0 to disable)
cors.corsXmlHint: Enter valid CORS configuration in XML format
cors.originRequired: At least one allowed origin is required
cors.methodRequired: At least one allowed method is required

lifecycle.title: Lifecycle Rules
lifecycle.confirmDeleteMsg: This will remove all lifecycle management rules for this bucket.
lifecycle.lifecycleInfo: Lifecycle policies automatically delete old versions and expired delete markers to save storage space.
lifecycle.noncurrentDaysHint: Automatically delete versions that are no longer the latest after this many days
lifecycle.deleteMarkersHint: Automatically remove delete markers when they are the only version remaining

notifications.title: Event Notifications
notifications.confirmDeleteAllMsg: This will remove all notification rules from this bucket.
notifications.confirmDeleteRuleMsg: This will remove this notification rule from the bucket.
notifications.noRulesDesc: Configure webhook notifications to receive real-time events when objects are created, modified, or deleted in this bucket.
notifications.infoItem1: Webhook notifications are sent as HTTP POST requests
notifications.infoItem2: Events follow AWS S3 notification format
notifications.infoItem3: Failed webhooks are retried up to 3 times
notifications.infoItem4: Use prefix/suffix filters to limit which objects trigger notifications
notifications.validationError: Please provide webhook URL and select at least one event
notifications.ruleIdHint: Unique identifier for this notification rule
notifications.webhookUrlHint: HTTP or HTTPS endpoint that will receive event notifications
notifications.prefixFilterHint: Only trigger for objects with this prefix
notifications.suffixFilterHint: Only trigger for objects with this suffix
notifications.webhookFormatItem1: Events are sent as HTTP POST requests with JSON payload
notifications.webhookFormatItem2: Payload follows AWS S3 event notification format
notifications.webhookFormatItem3: Failed deliveries are retried up to 3 times
notifications.webhookFormatItem4: Timeout is set to 10 seconds per request

replication.title: Bucket Replication
replication.confirmTriggerMsg: This will queue all objects in the source bucket for replication to the destination.
replication.syncTriggered: Replication sync triggered! {{count}} object(s) queued for replication.
replication.confirmDeleteMsg: This will remove this replication rule. Objects will no longer be replicated to the destination.
replication.noRulesDesc: Configure replication rules to automatically copy objects to another bucket. Support for cross-bucket, cross-region, and cross-tenant replication.
replication.infoItem1: Realtime mode replicates objects immediately after upload
replication.infoItem2: Scheduled mode processes replication in batches at intervals
replication.infoItem3: Batch mode processes large volumes of objects efficiently
replication.infoItem4: Use prefix filters to replicate only specific object paths
replication.infoItem5: Higher priority rules are processed first
replication.validationEndpoint: Please provide a destination endpoint URL
replication.validationCredentials: Please provide access key and secret key
replication.endpointHint: S3-compatible endpoint URL (AWS S3, MinIO, or another MaxIOFS instance)
replication.destBucketHint: The destination bucket name where objects will be replicated
replication.prefixHint: Only replicate objects with this prefix
replication.priorityHint: Higher priority rules are processed first
replication.conflictHint: Strategy for resolving conflicts when objects exist in both locations
replication.conflictLastWrite: Last Write Wins - Most recent version prevails
replication.requirementsItem1: Destination bucket must exist and be accessible
replication.requirementsItem2: Versioning is recommended for both source and destination
replication.requirementsItem3: Ensure appropriate permissions for cross-tenant replication
replication.requirementsItem4: Rules can be temporarily disabled without deleting them

inventory.title: Bucket Inventory
inventory.destBucketHint: Inventory reports will be saved to this bucket
inventory.scheduleTimeHint: Time when reports will be generated
inventory.confirmDeleteMsg: Are you sure you want to delete the inventory configuration?
inventory.infoItem1: Inventory reports provide a scheduled list of your objects and their metadata
inventory.infoItem2: Reports are generated automatically based on the configured frequency
inventory.infoItem3: Choose between CSV and JSON formats for compatibility with your tools
inventory.infoItem4: Select specific fields to include in your inventory reports
inventory.infoItem5: Reports are stored in the destination bucket you specify
